samples.question: In what situations do people usually ask for advice?
samples.transcript: Well, I believe in most cases people ask for advices because they are in need of help. For example, you would ask a doctor how to take care of your health, how to treat this disease, and you would ask your teacher on how to study this material, for example. And there are cases where you would ask your friend or your family how to deal with this trauma you have. Thank you. Good. Well done.

samples.question: And finally, is professional advice more valuable than personal advice?
samples.transcript: Well, some people believe that personal advice trumps over professional advice because of how we how we are so intimately related to each other. Well, I believe that professional professional advice still has much more value than personal advice because when you are the the advice you are given is from people who have studied a lot on this matter, people who have dealt with it, have ex more experience with the matter that you are dealing with. So I believe that at the end of the day their advice holds more information than people who might not have that much experience even though they closely related to you. Thank you. Well done and qua that brings us to the end of the test. Thank you very much for coming in today and I wish you all the best. Good job. Thank you. Amazing.

samples.question: Well, what do I do in the morning?
samples.transcript: Well, I actually wake up at sometime around 7 or 8:00 in the morning. I I start my day by drinking a glass of water and meditating for about 10 15 minutes. then I go for a jog in a nearby park and do a little bit of workouts which really energizes me. All right.

samples.question: Why do people help each other?
samples.transcript: Well, people help each other out of empathy and compassion. many feel a moral obligation to actually assist those in need as it strengthens community bonds and you know fosters a sense of belonging I think and do you think people nowadays are less willing to help others compared to the past well less willing well I can say I do not think people are less willing to help today you know while modern life can be fast-paced many actively engage in charitable activities you know often using social media to mobilize support for various causes. I think all right and should schools teach students the importance of helping others the importance of helping others in the schools. Well, yes. you know, schools should actually teach the importance of helping others. You know, instilling values of empathy and you know, social responsibility helps shape actually compassionate individuals and you know creates a more caring society I believe.
